blog.title: Bakubros
blog.description: i write Bakugou x reader scenarios. Ask box: CLOSED I try to post everyday. Art blog: momobuta

summary: Christmas Present pt. 3
title: Christmas Present pt. 3
body:
haha i said i would post VERY soon in my last ‘um hehe’ post. so here is the third part. thank you for liking this. i like you all very much for liking this. idk how many parts this will have. not too many tho. 

Your pen tapped against your chin as you were lost in thought. You leaned back in your chair heaving a loud sigh of exhaustion, stretching your arms up over your head and popping a few joints.

“You seem tired” a voice directed towards you.

You turn and see your friend standing at the doorway of your office. You wearily look at him, letting out a tired yawn. It’s been a long day.

“Got something on your mind?”

“Yeah… sorta… was it obvious?”

“You’ve been sitting staring at nothing with a blank look on your face for 10 minutes. It was pretty obvious”

You let out a weak chuckle, “I can’t help it. I got a lot on my mind right now”

“Wanna talk about it?”

To be honest since the whole talk about marriage surfaced, it sat in your mind now more than it had ever. Along with the holidays coming up didn’t help it at all. It was like you were expecting something now.

If it wasn’t that, then it was trying to figure out what to gift your lover for the holidays.

There wasn’t much talk about what presents you wanted from each other. Bakugou said he didn’t want anything in particular, he was already pretty set in anything he wanted to buy. So deciding on even a potential gift was hard.

“I don’t know what to give Katsuki for Christmas” you whine, slumping over your desk. “Well what does he like?”

“He likes mountain climbing, but there’s no way in hell I’m going up a fucking mountain in this weather” you grumble. “Whoa there language, guess Bakugou really rubbed off on ya huh” you scoff, rolling your eyes. “Well is there anything else he likes?”

“He likes spicy food, but we basically eat that almost every night. I guess I could make that special spicy ramen he really likes” you mumbled, mindlessly drawing circles on your desk with your finger, growing bored of the conversation.

“Hey there’s something. So he likes mountains, spicy ramen….oh yeah and you!”  

“Me?”

“Well you’re his girlfriend after all, why don’t you just be his present!”

Your face burns hot at his silly suggestion, “Wha-what the hell are you talking about!” you throw the closest object at your friend. “Don’t say it like that idiot, it sounds embarrassing…” your friend laughing as you shy away, “I don’t mean anything weird of course. I mean like give yourself to him. Like forever?” you quirk an eyebrow at him, but you quickly catch onto what he was implying. “Marriage talk again? What are you my mother? You sound like you’re trying to tell me I’m getting old and need to marry as soon as possible, hello??? I’m still only 22 (y/f/n)!” growing annoyed and even more exhausted by the second.

“I know I know, sorry I’ll drop it now. Hey don’t be sad, you’ll figure out what to get him. C’mon let’s go home you’re tired.” Getting up from your seat and pulling on your thick coat, you follow your friend out the door. “Hell yeah I am”

~

Walking into your shared apartment with your boyfriend, you drop your bags and shoes by the door, too tired to even bother placing them down neatly. Hanging up your coat on the coat rack, your boyfriends tattered muffler catching your eye. He had been using that same old muffler since high school hadn’t he? You walked into your lit living room to be greeted by the ash blonde. Taking short strides to him and sharing a short, but sweet kiss with your lover.

“Hey how was work?” he asks, though your loud yawn was enough explanation to him how it went. “I’m exhausted, I’m about to pass out” leaving to your shared bedroom, ready for a good nights rest. Bakugou stays glued to his spot on the couch, but something didn’t quite seem right.

He had this unsettling feeling that something was out of place. Something really important. Something that he shouldn’t miss, or shouldn’t be missing. Like he had forgotten something…

He had left the ring on the nightstand out in the open.

He darted towards the bedroom, so fast he probably would’ve been in the Guinness World Records for first man to travel faster than the speed of light. You had heard him approaching from behind, but he was moving too quick you couldn’t even process what was going on or what he was doing. Bakugou just bolted straight for the table, quickly snatching the small box and shoving it deep into his pocket. All you could do was stare at the male in shock and confusion.

“Um babe?” you call to him questioningly, “Are you… ok?” Bakugou hadn’t realized he was heaving. The sudden sprint putting him out of breath, his face was flushed and his panting heavy as he slumped onto his knees and his back facing you.

“Yeah… I’m fine” that had probably been the oddest thing you had ever witnessed the blonde male do. You could’ve probed further at his sudden rush but you were too tired to even care anymore. Your mind was already worn out from your conversation with your friend earlier and all you really wanted at this point was to sleep.

But there was a small thing that didn’t go ignored by you.

What did he throw into his pocket?

~

It had taken a lot of brain power and creativity to finally brew up a gift for your boyfriend. Taking note of the old muffler that sat in your home, combined with Bakugou’s distaste of the cold. You came to the conclusion of gifting him a scarf.

But not just any scarf. A homemade scarf. Making it all the more meaningful.

At first it had sounded so old fashioned to you, and you could have easily just bought a new one yourself. Maybe even splurging and getting something designer, but you knew all too well that Bakugou didn’t really care for brands or style, so it wouldn’t really matter would it?

You also wanted to give something that was from the heart. It was cheesy but you wanted him to use something that was made by you, that you put your hard work and love into. Something about homemade things warmed your heart, and you hoped he would see it as a good luck charm, or some sort of symbol in a way.

You stopped by the fabric store on the way home from work, browsing through the different yarns. There were so many different textures and colors, you were lost and could easily spend hours in there just trying to pick out one spool of yarn.

Ultimately you chose a simple red yarn, the texture not too soft but not at all uncomfortable. You also picked up some knitting needles.

To be honest you had never knitted anything in your life, but you figured you could get away by looking up tutorials online. Easy enough right?

Wrong.

It had taken you a while to get used to using the needles and figuring out how to keep the right length and pattern. Practicing any free time you got, whether it was at home, in the office or even on the toilet, still while being wary of Bakugou who could spoil the surprise anytime he came around. You were determined to get this done by Christmas.

Bakugou on the other hand had still not gotten anywhere closer to what in the hell he was going to do with his gift. Ever since the little slip up, he was more cautious of where he kept the box. Hiding it behind some books on the bookshelf at home, or keeping it in his pocket whenever he left the house. Other than the ring constantly on his mind, he was also thinking of various scenarios of how the proposal would play out.

Maybe he would propose that night when you came home from work

Nah. That would be too sudden.

Perhaps go on a little date night at fancy restaurant and propose there?

Lame. Sounds like some cliche shit out of a movie.

Gather friends and family for a big surprise engagement party?

He hates everyone.

This was harder than he thought. This was really too fucking hard. Why was it so damn fucking hard!?

It frustrated Bakugou to no end. He always went about just jumping into things, doing however he pleases – the outcome always working out. His mind was a steam engine, always pumping nonstop and going at full force. But why was proposing to the beautiful love of his life, the one he wanted to spend eternity with, the one he would go through heaven and hell for, like trying to solve the hardest math problem in the world?

This was a problem in its own form, and that form being Bakugou’s mind. As much as he would like to get it over with and just abruptly drop the question on you. He wanted to make it special.

Nah. That would be too sudden.

Perhaps go on a little date night at fancy restaurant and propose there?

Lame. Sounds like some cliche shit out of a movie.

Gather friends and family for a big surprise engagement party?

He hates everyone.

This was harder than he thought. This was really too fucking hard. Why was it so damn fucking hard!?

It frustrated Bakugou to no end. He always went about just jumping into things, doing however he pleases – the outcome always working out. His mind was a steam engine, always pumping nonstop and going at full force. But why was proposing to the beautiful love of his life, the one he wanted to spend eternity with, the one he would go through heaven and hell for, like trying to solve the hardest math problem in the world?

This was a problem in its own form, and that form being Bakugou’s mind. As much as he would like to get it over with and just abruptly drop the question on you. He wanted to make it special.

summary: Boku: Yasu is excited for his stage play. His relatives saw his poster pic without glasses and ask if he's okay not wearing it....
body:
Boku: Yasu is excited for his stage play. His relatives saw his poster pic without glasses and ask if he’s okay not wearing it. He say it’s true that he havent fully recover from the injury he suffer from the time he lost consciousness in April.

But he has gotten a lot better so he just want to state facts and not to make you worry (I guess he saw josei joshin report that wrote about him too in Kura article). He then tell the reason why he want to do live performances even when he havent fully recover.

He said the sensation & the heat that you feel with your whole senses and flooding your head during lives is something that you need to feel on your own & couldnt easily be described into words. He also believes ppl who had watched that lives will receive that energy. And be encouraged & stimulation by that energy & lead it into influencing the different paths/lives of the audience. The lines, the characters way of life & the way they expressed it will be embedded into the audience hearts. It’s something that cant be conveyed.

Or felt through screen and that is why Yasu wanted to take the risk to do the play even when he havent fully recover. And when the stage play start, he may sometimes act without his glasses but what he want is you to see his determination. He didnt want you to come and watch with worry though. All in all, yeah, he havent fully recover. He needs the glasses during his recovery & he’s not supposed to remove it but he is recovering and he wants you to feel his passion and how he live his life to the fullest on stage later.

He’s excited! 💙

summary: Sorry for the wait here it is the completed version of Iida Tenya. This is him about to perform a heroic act you can see it in...
caption:
Sorry for the wait here it is the completed version of Iida Tenya. This is him about to perform a heroic act you can see it in his eyes! I really liked how this one came out and I believe that as far as my coloring style goes this will be close to it. Of course as I grow so will it. Tell me what you think. Also, I’m thinking of dropping a illustration course is that something that you’d like to see?!

summary: Boku 7/11: Yasu talk about creation of my dreams. He listened to ANN when Kura revealed about it and said probably they shdnt be...
body:
Boku 7/11: Yasu talk about creation of my dreams. He listened to ANN when Kura revealed about it and said probably they shdnt be bragging about it since they’re the creator but it got great lyrics & melody lmao

Chronology: kura ask yasu if they could create a song together for kansai jr -> yasu said yes-> kura wrote lyrics, send it to yasu -> yasu voice record the melody & send it to kura -> kura adjusted the lyrics & send it to yasu->yasu record the melody again acapella-> Different day kurayasu create the demo together at home. Yasu on guitar kura on cajon

kura is particular about the techicality (where drums, piano etc comes) but yasu told him the most important thing abt this song is he wants the emotion, story & passion in this song be felt by everyone throughout their body. Kurayasu too told the jrs about what to convey & how to convey the songs so that the emotion come across during recording. Yasu wants this ‘baby’ song to mature along with jr fans

Be passed down to the next generations of jrs. Overall, Yasu is realllly reallllly proud of the lyrics that Kura had written! X3 Thank you for such beautiful songs Yasu & Kura!!
